summary: Final Fantasy Audio Conversion, Gets rid of all that boring Skyrim music and replaces it with a Final Fantasy series giving an epic Nostalgia!
descriptionHtml:
I DO NOT take any credit for the tracks and sounds used in this mod they belong to Yasunori Mitsuda and SquareEnix.

It is upon agreement that I list his websites here 

http://www.procyon-studio.com/
http://mitsuda.cocoebiz.com/
http://twitter.com/yasunorimitsuda
http://www.procyon-studio.com/blog/
http://www.kijimuna.fr/mitsuda/

, I am simply a FAN. However I do take credit for making this mod and putting the time into it. 

You can,
1. Use the mod for personal use.
2. Endorse me :p
3. Review the mod as long as proper credits are given to 
- SquareEnix and Yasunori Mitsuda

You CANNOT
1. Alter the files in any way shape or form
2. Convert the files to sound or audio files and use them outside of my mod
3. Use this mod or any of the contents in it for making profit 




If you are like me, then you searched for hours trying to find a music overhaul for, YEP Final Fantasy!

FINAL FANTASY AUDIO CONVERSION

This mod replaces all of the Skyrim music and sounds and appropriately places music and sounds from the Final Fantasy series. Specifically between FFVII - FFXIII-2 and Chrono Cross.

Anyways I searched forever trying to find something like this..and all I found was some lame ass version of FF VI on Steam.


F.F.A.C is for you IF,

1. Your are a Final Fantasy fan
2. You are getting bored or tired of the music and sounds of Skyrim
3. You don\'t know what Final Fantasy is..shame on you, download it anyways xD
4. You want an epic music experience while playing Skyrim
5. If you are Human


Version 1.0  (music and sounds)

1. Combat (normal and boss) <<< Even has the Fanfare at the end of the battle :P 
2. Main menu
3. Cursor (sounds)
4. Dungeons
5. Castles
6. Cave
7. Explore (Morning, Day, Dusk and Night)
8. Dread
9. Intro
10. Forts
11. Towns
12. Villages
13. Taverns
14. Level up (music)
15. Level up (sounds)


Coming in version 1.5!!

-Palette music 


Installation:

Nexus Mod Manager
Just hit the button that says \"Download With Manager\"

Manual
Take the 2 folders 1. Music 2. Sound, and place them into your Data Directory 

Should be something like this 
C:\\program files (x86)\\steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\data

Uninstall:

Why would you wanna do that?! :O

Just undo what you did lol



If you like my mod/s please give me some feedback and endorse. 
I like to hear from you guys, especially if you are using my mod it helps keep me motivated to do more with modding!
author: MYAOx10
